overview:
Dave is the co-creator of The Decathlon (www.thedecathlon.org) and CharityBets (www.charitybets.org).

Since 2009, The Decathlon has brought together men employed within the financial services industry to compete in an athletic event where the winner is crowned “Wall Street’s Best Athlete” and competitors use proprietary technology to raise money for cancer research. In 2011, The Decathlon established a partnership with Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center. The Decathlon has been featured on CNBC, Bloomberg, The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, and Dealbreaker.com.

In 2011, Maloney co-founded CharityBets which expands The Decathlon’s performance-based fundraising model. CharityBets realigns the relationship between a donor and competitor by facilitating donations which are determined by how well, or how poorly, a competitor performs in an athletic event relative to the competitor’s defined performance goal. Using an abbreviated version of CharityBet’s donating option, The Decathlon has raised over $325,000 since 2009, an average of $9,000 per competitor.
